ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acute Otitis Media
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sudden onset bilateral mixed hearing loss, aural fullness, history of bad allergies, and Type B tympanograms consistent with middle ear fluid/infection.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Otitis Media with Effusion
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Presence of middle ear fluid indicated by air-bone gaps and flat tympanograms, likely secondary to allergic rhinitis.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and tympanic membrane mobility.
To assess the integrity of the acoustic reflex arc and middle ear status.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates bilateral mixed hearing loss, worse in the left ear, with significant air-bone gaps. Immittance testing reveals flat tympanograms (Type B) bilaterally with normal ear canal volumes and absent acoustic reflexes, strongly suggesting middle ear pathology such as effusion. Despite the hearing loss, word recognition scores are excellent, indicating intact cochlear function for speech understanding.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral mixed hearing loss. Right ear: mild sloping to moderate (250-2000 Hz) then to severe. Left ear: mild sloping to moderate (250-2000 Hz) then to profound. Significant air-bone gaps bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT (Right 42 dB, Left 48 dB) consistent with PTA. WRS excellent (100%) bilaterally at suprathreshold levels (Right 75 dB HL, Left 80 dB HL).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Flat (Type B) tympanograms bilaterally with normal ear canal volumes (Right 1.5 mL, Left 1.2 mL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes at 500, 1000, 2000, and 4000 Hz bilaterally.

proposed_items: Medical management of acute otitis media
counseling_actions: Explain the mixed nature of the hearing loss due to fluid in the middle ear
Discuss the relationship between allergies and middle ear fluid
Reassure the patient regarding excellent word recognition ability
Advise on the importance of medication compliance and follow-up

escalation.rationale_short: Immediate medical management required for sudden hearing loss diagnosed as acute otitis media.

follow_up_plan.objective: To monitor resolution of middle ear pathology and hearing status following medical treatment.
